relevant_findings.general: Alert and oriented x3, no acute distress
relevant_findings.HEENT: PERRLA, sclera nonicteric, dry mucous membranes, oropharynx clear without lesions
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, soft systolic murmur heard at left sternal border
relevant_findings.abdomen: Soft, nondistended, rebound tenderness, pain on palpation most in umbilical and left lower quadrant, no hepatosplenomegaly appreciated, normoactive bowel sounds
relevant_findings.extremities: No clubbing, cyanosis or edema; 2+ dorsalis pedis pulses bilaterally
relevant_findings.neurological: Cranial nerves II-XII intact, strength upper and lower extremities adequate, sensation grossly intact, 2+ brachioradialis and biceps reflexes

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: There was an improvement in vital signs during admission; initial vitals indicated a higher heart rate (111 bpm) and blood pressure (125/87 mmHg) compared to the later readings (89 bpm, 107/49 mmHg).
